lexUnit.name: preliminary.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a preliminary action or event.

sentence.text: After the usual preliminaries and courtesies from the Chair , the Minister of Transport outlined the Government 's proposals before the Chairman threw the subject open for discussion .
Without any preliminaries he began interrogating Dad .
Watching this violation of the body 's orifices , preliminaries to the scientific brutality to follow , had always made him feel uncomfortably like a voyeur .
Subhadra began speaking intensely , without preliminaries .
After these preliminaries , including some observations about Kensington , conducted before a rather feeble gas-fire , we moved to the low-ceilinged dining-room .
Watching this violation of the body 's orifices , preliminaries to the scientific brutality to follow , had always made him feel uncomfortably like a voyeur .
Of course such a stage is an essential preliminary to the formulation of a theory of the performance of action .

Sometimes , as with Kant , a period of more or less authoritarian government under an enlightened prince was seen as a necessary preliminary to the introduction of a more liberal and representative form of rule .
As a preliminary to the ceremony , the Northern Ireland Royal Marine Band will march through Middlesbrough at 2 pm and give a performance on the Russell Street boulevard .
The introduction of a unified rouble exchange rate , due on July 1 as a preliminary to full convertibility , appeared to have been postponed .
As he became a monk at Christ Church as a preliminary , it looks as though Cnut did not feel able to ride roughshod over the church of Canterbury .
A necessary preliminary is to clarify the meaning of the term ` rule " .
Therefore , an essential preliminary to serious work on the Abbey archives is the compilation of a separate index of records at the Abbey that relate to the early modern period .
A PDS deputy , Giorgio Napolitano , was elected as Speaker of the Chamber of Deputies on June 3 --an important preliminary to the appointment of a Prime Minister and a new government .
For him it was a tedious preliminary to discovering whether he had something truly in common with another human being .
Description of social conditions was a preliminary to political reform .
